name: market for tap water | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19676/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'tap water', in the geography of Peru.;This dataset describes average tap water available, at user, in Peru. Water distribution being rather local, if tap water is a significant contributor to a given LCA, it is advisable, where possible, to make direct links to the actual water treatment technology model rather than the regional average this market dataset will represent.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.

This activity starts from tap water, under pressure, at tap water treatment plant and fed into the tap water distribution network.

This activity ends with 1 kg of water at consumer (industrial or household).

This dataset includes: 
 - the distribution network
 - water losses during transmission 

This dataset doesn't include
 - energy used during distribution for additional pressure. The tap water is already under pressure when fed into the network (see corresponding tap water production datasets). The implicit assumption is that no additional energy is required during distribution to overcome loss of load in the distribution network. This assumption is not always correct.
 - emissions to groundwater associated with water leaving the distribution network through leaks. These are assumed to be inconsequential since we are dealing with treated tap water.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volumes associated with potable water production are based on 2015 production volume.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Water loss in distribution network based on average Peruvian value (35%) [taken from: Peru: Drinking water supply and sanitation article- Servicio de Agua Potable y Alcantarillado de la 
Libertad - SEDALIB S.A. - https://www.kfw-entwicklungsbank.de/migration/Entwicklungsbank-Startseite/Development-Finance/Evaluation/Results-and-Publications/PDF-Dokumente-L-P/Peru_Drinking_Water_Trujillo_2004.pdf Accessed online on July 26, 2017]

exchanges.description: Calculated value taken from the dataset "market for tap water" (GLO) (accessed on the 2017-11-14) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. The data is based on the total output (yearly transported amount * lifetime) and network length, all based on the Anytown model. See corresponding infrastructure dataset for more details on these assumptions.
